questions.question: What is the formula for the range of a projectile?
wrongAnswers: R = (v^2 * cos(2θ)) / g
R = (v * sin(θ)) / g
R = (v^2 * tan(θ)) / g

questions.question: How does air resistance affect projectile motion?
questions.answer: Air resistance reduces the range and alters the trajectory.
wrongAnswers: Air resistance has no effect on projectile motion.
Air resistance increases the range of the projectile.
Air resistance only affects vertical motion.

questions.question: What is the maximum height of a projectile?
wrongAnswers: H = (v * sin(θ)) / g
H = (v^2 * tan(θ)) / g

questions.question: What factors affect the time of flight of a projectile?
questions.answer: Initial velocity, launch angle, and acceleration due to gravity.
wrongAnswers: Only the initial velocity affects the time of flight.
The launch angle has no effect on the time of flight.
Air resistance is the only factor affecting time of flight.

questions.question: What is Bifilar Suspension?
questions.answer: A system where an object is suspended by two parallel threads or wires of equal length.
wrongAnswers: A system using magnetic fields to suspend objects
A single wire suspension technique
A method of suspending objects using electrostatic forces

questions.question: What is the formula for the period of oscillation in a bifilar suspension?
wrongAnswers: T = 2π√(m/k)
T = 2π√(L/g)
T = 2π√(md²/I)

questions.question: How can bifilar suspension be used to determine moment of inertia?
questions.answer: By measuring the period of oscillation and using the formula I = mgd²T²/4π²
wrongAnswers: By measuring the angular velocity directly
By calculating the torque applied to the system
By determining the resonant frequency of the system

questions.question: What happens to the period of oscillation if the separation between the threads is increased?
wrongAnswers: The period increases
The period remains unchanged
The period becomes zero

quizlets.name: Frequency of AC Mains by Melde's Method

questions.question: What is Melde's method primarily used for?
questions.answer: To determine the frequency of AC current using standing waves in a string
wrongAnswers: To measure the voltage of AC current
To calculate resistance in electrical circuits
To determine the wavelength of light

questions.question: In Melde's method, what is the relationship between the frequency of vibration and the length of the loop?
questions.answer: f = v/2L, where v is the wave velocity and L is the length of the loop
wrongAnswers: f = 2Lv
f = L/v
f = v²/L

questions.question: What is the principle behind Melde's experiment?
questions.answer: An alternating current in a wire placed in a magnetic field creates mechanical vibrations of the same frequency
wrongAnswers: Electromagnetic induction creates standing waves
Resonance occurs at specific frequencies determined by the power supply
AC current directly vibrates the string through electrical attraction

questions.question: How does tension in the string affect the frequency in Melde's experiment?
questions.answer: Increasing tension increases the frequency of standing waves for a given length
wrongAnswers: Tension has no effect on the frequency
Increasing tension decreases the frequency
Tension only affects the amplitude, not the frequency
